JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: The applicants are all NORP nationals . Their names , dates of birth , the names of their representatives and the dates on which they lodged their applications appear in the appendix .
The facts of the cases , as submitted by the applicants , may be summarised as follows .
On different dates the applicants registered with ORG ( ORG , “ the ORG ” ) or ORG for ORG ( Bağ - Kur ) .

Subsequent to their registration , they all lodged actions seeking the correction of their dates of birth , which had initially been registered erroneously in their birth records . As a result , the applicants’ ages were increased by DATE by court decisions to reflect their biological ages .

When they reached the minimum age limit for retirement on the basis of their rectified dates of birth , the applicants applied to the ORG or to PERSON - Kur for retirement pensions . Their requests were , however , rejected as they were not considered to have fulfilled the conditions set out in the relevant laws to receive such benefits ( LAW no . CARDINAL and LAW no . DATE ) . The applicants were informed that , for the purpose of determining eligibility for pension benefits , a person ’s age was calculated on the basis of the date of birth declared at the time of registration with the social security institutions ; subsequent amendments to the date of birth would thus not be taken into account .

The applicants subsequently brought actions before labour courts seeking declaratory judgments ( tespit davası ) regarding their eligibility for retirement pensions in the light of their amended dates of birth . In all cases the labour courts dismissed the ORG requests on the same legal grounds as the decisions of the social security institutions . ORG upheld these judgments .
The details regarding these proceedings appear in the table below .
Section CARDINAL A of Law no . CARDINAL provides :
“ In order for insured [ persons ] to benefit from the old - age insurance ,
a ) Women must have reached the age of CARDINAL and men sixty and [ they must have made contributions for ] a minimum of DATE , or

b ) Women must have reached the age of CARDINAL and men sixty and [ they must have been ] insured for DATE and [ have paid ] a minimum of DATE of premiums in respect of disability , old - age and death insurance . ”

“ ... In the implementation of the age - related provisions [ of this PERSON ] within the context of disability , old - age and death insurance , ... the date of birth recorded in the ORG register at the time of taking up of the job within the terms of this PERSON ... shall be taken into account .

In the calculation of the income and DATE allowances ... [ deriving ] from ... oldage insurance , corrections of age made after DATE on which [ the person ] commenced working subject to ... Law no . CARDINAL or other social security institutions , shall not be taken into consideration . ”
Section CARDINAL of Law no . DATE provides :
“ In order for insured [ persons ] to benefit from old - age insurance ,
b ) Women must have reached the age of CARDINAL and men sixty and they must have paid insurance premiums for DATE . ”
Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL provides :

“ ... In the implementation of the age - related provisions [ of this PERSON ] within the context of disability , old - age and death insurance , ... the date of birth recorded in the ORG register at the time of taking up of the job within the terms of this PERSON ... shall be taken into account . ”
